required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Thawing Embryos in Advance and on the Day of Transfer on Pregnancy Outcomes in FET Cycle
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Effects of Thawing Embryos in Advance and Thawing on the Day of Transfer on Pregnancy Outcomes in the Frozen Embryo Transfer Cycle

brief_summary.textblock: Respectively for patients with repeated transplant failure and routine patients, Thawing frozen embryos in advance (18h) to extend the duration of embryonic development or thawing embryos on the day of transfer in the frozen embryo transfer cycle, to analyze which way can improve clinical pregnancy outcomes, is there a significant difference between the two ways or two types of patients?

detailed_description.textblock:
Although in clinical practice, thawed embryos with appropriate development time will be selected strictly according to the number of days after ovulation, there are still two problems in actual clinical treatment: one is the embryonic factor, although the rate of embryonic development is generally the same, However, the phenomenon of delayed embryo division and development often occurs. The second is the endometrial factor. There are reports that a small number of people will move the transplant window forward, or the transplant window is narrow. This potentially creates the risk of embryo-endometrial mismatch. Based on this, the research team focused on patients with frozen embryo transfer cycles and put forward the strategy of "thawing embryos in advance and prolonging the development period of embryos properly" in an effort to achieve better repair of damage caused by embryo freezing and fine-tuning of embryo-endometrial interaction time. Therefore, it is necessary to compare thawing embryos in advance and thawing on the day of transfer on pregnancy outcomes in patients with repeated transplant failure and routine patients respectively.
The purpose of this study is to analyze which way can improve clinical pregnancy and birth outcomes, is there a significant difference between the two ways or two types of patients?

primary_outcome.description: Observe the clinical pregnancy rate under different embryo thawing time
Observe the live birth rate under different embryo thawing time

arm_group.description: Thawing embryos one day in advance (16:00), 18h before embryos transfer (10:00).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Thawing Embryos on the Day of Transfer
arm_group.description: Thawing embryos on the day of transfer (8:00), 2h before embryos transfer (10:00).

intervention.description: Thaw Embryos one day in Advance

intervention.intervention_name: Thawing Embryos on the Day of Transfer
intervention.description: Thaw Embryos on the morning of transfer day.
intervention.arm_group_label: Thawing Embryos on the Day of Transfer

eligibility.gender_description: Women in childbearing age intend to do IVF-FET

facility.name: Jinan Central Hospital Affiliated to Shandong University
